fact_check_explanation_title: Mirror’s claim that households will be £2,000 a year poorer overstates impact of inflation
fact_check_explanation_summary: Its estimate combined various price rises and the fall in real wages. But this effectively counts some rising prices twice.

fact_check_explanation_title: Keanu Reeves did not say ‘humanity is showing signs of breaking free from the matrix’
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence the star of the Matrix franchise ever said humanity was being kept in a ‘mental prison’ by elites.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS video overstates the risk of Covid-19 to children
fact_check_explanation_summary: A doctor in the video said that one in 100 children with Covid-19 get sick enough to go to hospital. The real risk is probably a fraction of that.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral posts about £49 fuel vouchers are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that struggling households are entitled to almost £100 in fuel vouchers annually have been shared thousands of times.

fact_check_explanation_title: False US military health data misrepresented as NHS figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Instagram claims that infertility and neurological conditions have increased by more than 400%.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know how many children aren’t on school rolls
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Children’s Commissioner for England recently claimed that 80,000 to 100,000 children weren’t on any school roll.

fact_check_explanation_title: Australian police taking no action over politician ‘arrest warrants’
fact_check_explanation_summary: New South Wales police were given documents from a protest group but say they are planning no further action.

fact_check_explanation_title: West Yorkshire Police is not investigating the Covid-19 vaccine programme
fact_check_explanation_summary: Numerous Facebook posts incorrectly claim the Covid-19 vaccine programme is being investigated by West Yorkshire Police.

fact_check_explanation_title: Jacob Rees-Mogg wrong to suggest morning after pill is ‘abortifacient’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jacob Rees-Mogg appeared to refer to the morning after pill as an ‘abortifacient’ in parliament. That’s not what it is.

fact_check_explanation_title: GP’s article overstates the number of Covid-19 deaths in children
fact_check_explanation_summary: An estimate of at least 133 deaths includes 18- and 19-year-olds, and some which may have had a different underlying cause.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated Brits won’t have AIDS by the end of February 2022
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article posted on Facebook makes baseless claims that vaccines cause AIDS and will lead to a huge number of deaths in children.

fact_check_explanation_title: Rishi Sunak wrong to say we’ve had a ‘colder  than usual’ winter
fact_check_explanation_summary: So far UK temperatures have been milder than usual, according to the Met Office.
